column1: Malakwal (Urdu: ملکوال ‎) is a city in Mandi Bahauddin District

column5: and followed it by the conquests of Punjab region. The Delhi Sultanate and later Mughal Empire ruled the region. The Punjab region became predominantly Muslim due to missionary Sufi saints whose dargahs dot the landscape of Punjab region.

column1: After the formation of the Sikh Empire in 1801
column2: Malakwal was invaded and occupied by Sikhs. During the period of British rule
column3: Malakwal increased in population and importance.

column1: The predominantly Muslim population supported Muslim League and Pakistan Movement. After the independence of Pakistan in 1947
column2: the minority Hindus and Sikhs migrated to India while the Muslims refugees from India settled down here.

column1: Malakwal lies on the south/east bank of river Jehlam and is sandwiched between River Jehlam and Lower Jehlam Canal. It is a tehsil and sub-divisional headquarter of Mandi Bahauddin District of province Punjab
column2: Pakistan. It is located approximately 200 km far away from Islamabad in southeast direction which is country's capital and 35 km from its district headquarters Mandi Bahauddin. It has a moderate climate. During peak of summer day
column4: and falls to 2 °C in the months of December and January.

column1: Some part of Malakwal city lies in the district Sargodha .Malakwal is situated on Shahpur Mandi bahauddin highway.
Malakwal has a railway station that is also a junction. There are boys and girls degree colleges available for both boys and girls.

column3: Bar Musa and Gojra are the big towns of Malakwal tehsil.

column1: Malakwal is also known for the Daffer forest and Mona Depot
column3: this Mona Depot was named after the village Mona
